condition.description:
If you have coronary artery disease, the arteries in your heart are narrowed or blocked by a sticky material called plaque. Angioplasty is a procedure to restore blood flow through the artery.

You have angioplasty in a hospital. The doctor threads a thin tube through a blood vessel in the arm or groin up to the involved site in the artery. The tube has a tiny balloon on the end. When the tube is in place, the doctor inflates the balloon to push the plaque outward against the wall of the artery. This widens the artery and restores blood flow.

Doctors may use angioplasty to

  • Reduce chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart
  • Minimize damage to heart muscle from a heart attack

Many people go home the day after angioplasty, and are able to return to work within a week of coming home.

NIH: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute
indications: blood clot prevention during coronary angioplasty
condition.name: Coronary angioplasty

indications: Blood clot prevention during coronary angioplasty

carousel_items: Using low doses (81mg) of aspirin every day can lower your risk of heart attack and stroke, but it isn't good for everyone. Only take aspirin daily if your doctor recommends it.
Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.
Take with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Don't use for kids younger than 18 years old.
Stop taking this right away and tell your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.

clock.tip: Take with food or milk to lower stomach upset.

basics.benefits_moa: Aspirin is a salicylate and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain. It also prevents blood platelets from forming clots, which thins your blood.
basics.bottom_line: A low dose of Aspirin (81mg) every day can protect your heart, but it's not the best medicine to take for pain, swelling, or fever.
downsides: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

downsides_processed.orig: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

upsides: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

upsides_processed.orig: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.
Used in higher doses to relieve pain, swelling, and fever.
Available over-the-counter in drugstores by itself and in combination with other cold and flu medications.

drugs.one_liner: Relieves pain, fever, and inflammation. Protects your heart and thins blood.

userStories.tip: research and understand the actual reason to take this medicine, as well as any medicine - than it will be helpful. Don't take it "just because". High quality Aspirin (e.g. Bayer) is much better (better effect without harming)

Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.

Stop taking this right away and tell your doctor if you have ringing in your ears, unusual bleeding, or nausea or vomiting that doesn't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage or death from Reye's Syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

description_processed.orig: Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Aspirin, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Aspirin can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Aspirin, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Aspirin can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Aspirin can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breathe or can cause a severe rash that can be life threatening. Get medical help immediately if you develop a skin rash, fever, swelling, or have trouble breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin can cause birth defects. Don't use Aspirin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Aspirin can cause birth defects. Don't use Aspirin while pregnant. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

carousel_items: Thins your blood to prevent clots from forming or getting bigger. Doesn't break up existing clots.
The amount you need depends on your diet, other medical problems, and genes.
Take it exactly as instructed.
Can raise your risk of bleeding or bruising.
Requires regular blood tests to get your dose right.
Interacts with a lot of medicines and supplements. Don't start any new meds without talking to your doctor.
Eat foods containing consistent amounts of Vitamin K.
Tell your doctor immediately if you fell or if you have unusual bleeding, bruising, swelling, or changes in vision and coordination.
Get a medical bracelet so that people know you're on a blood thinner during an emergency situation.

basics.benefits_moa: Warfarin is an anticoagulant blood thinner. It lowers chemicals called clotting factors so that it's harder for your body to form blood clots.
basics.bottom_line: Warfarin is an old, cheap, and effective medicine to prevent blood clots, but it requires some monitoring, dose adjustments, and even lifestyle changes.
downsides: Raises your risk of bleeding and bruising.
Requires routine blood testing (called an INR) to see how well the medicine is working for you and to make the dose just right for you.
Many lifestyle factors can affect how well warfarin works, such as diet, alcohol, and activity level, so it's important that you try to stay consistent with your behaviors.
Lots of interactions with other drugs or supplements. Always check with your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new meds.

downsides_processed.orig: Raises your risk of bleeding and bruising.
Requires routine blood testing (called an INR) to see how well the medicine is working for you and to make the dose just right for you.
Many lifestyle factors can affect how well warfarin works, such as diet, alcohol, and activity level, so it's important that you try to stay consistent with your behaviors.
Lots of interactions with other drugs or supplements. Always check with your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new meds.

upsides: Oral blood-thinning medicine that prevents blood clots from forming or getting bigger.

Prevents complications of blood clots that can cause extreme discomfort or death. Examples include stroke (blood clots in the brain), pulmonary embolism (blood clots in the lungs causing trouble breathing), or deep vein thrombosis (blood clots in the legs causing pain and blood vessel damage).
Has an antidote, Vitamin K, in case of a major accidental bleeding.
Warfarin has been around for a long time, so we know a lot about how well it works and what the risks are.

upsides_processed.orig: Oral blood-thinning medicine that prevents blood clots from forming or getting bigger.

Prevents complications of blood clots that can cause extreme discomfort or death. Examples include stroke (blood clots in the brain), pulmonary embolism (blood clots in the lungs causing trouble breathing), or deep vein thrombosis (blood clots in the legs causing pain and blood vessel damage).
Has an antidote, Vitamin K, in case of a major accidental bleeding.
Warfarin has been around for a long time, so we know a lot about how well it works and what the risks are.

Take it exactly as instructed.

Eat foods containing consistent amounts of Vitamin K.
Tell your doctor immediately if you fell or if you have unusual bleeding, bruising, swelling, or changes in vision and coordination.

risks_warnings.title: Life threatening bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Warfarin is a blood thinner that makes it harder for your blood to clot. Your body may not be able to stop bleeds the way it normally does. Regular monitoring through blood tests, taking the exact amount as instructed, and having a consistent diet can lower your risk of bleeding. Let your doctor know about any persistent or frequent bleeding or bruising, pink urine, red or coffee-ground like stools. If you are bleeding a lot for more than 15 minutes, have a bruise that is getting bigger instead of better, or have fallen and hit your head, go get immediate medical help. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that can reverse the effects of Warfarin.

description_processed.orig: Warfarin is a blood thinner that makes it harder for your blood to clot. Your body may not be able to stop bleeds the way it normally does. Regular monitoring through blood tests, taking the exact amount as instructed, and having a consistent diet can lower your risk of bleeding. Let your doctor know about any persistent or frequent bleeding or bruising, pink urine, red or coffee-ground like stools. If you are bleeding a lot for more than 15 minutes, have a bruise that is getting bigger instead of better, or have fallen and hit your head, go get immediate medical help. In the hospital, doctors can give you a medicine that can reverse the effects of Warfarin.

risks_warnings.title: Dying skin or tissue needing surgery or amputation
risks_warnings.description: Warfarin can cause this rare, but serious, condition where the skin or tissue is dying from poor blood flow. The risk is highest in the first few days to week 8 of starting Warfarin. Let your doctor know about any unusual changes in color of your extremities, breasts, or penis. Your doctor will then find you another blood-thinning medicine to replace Warfarin.

description_processed.orig: Warfarin can cause this rare, but serious, condition where the skin or tissue is dying from poor blood flow. Your doctor will then find you another blood-thinning medicine to replace Warfarin.

carousel_items: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Works best if you take it once a day after your evening meal.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.
Certain medications can interact with this drug. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist.

clock.tip: Take with evening meal and avoid grapefruit juice.
Take with food and avoid grapefruit juice.

basics.benefits_moa: Lovastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Lovastatin can improve cholesterol, but it's not as strong as other statin medicines. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Not the best choice for people who have very high cholesterol levels.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Not the best choice for people who have very high cholesterol levels.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Lowers bad cholesterol and triglycerides, and raises good cholesterol.
Most people reach their target cholesterol levels in 4 to 6 weeks.
Works best if you take it once a day after your evening meal.
Avoid grapefruit and grapefruit juice while taking this medicine.
Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, fever, or weakness.
Tell your doctor if you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin.
Certain medications can interact with this drug. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Lovastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.

description_processed.orig: There are rare cases of muscle damage leading to kidney failure in people taking Lovastatin. The risk is greater in people with kidney disease or thyroid disease, are older and female and taking certain cholesterol-lowering medication combinations. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no known cause.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Lovastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of liver damage in people who take Lovastatin, especially if they are heavy alcohol drinkers or have a history of liver disease. risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.
risk_factors: Taking with certain drugs that increase the dose of Lovastatin in the body

description_processed.orig: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.

risks_warnings.title: Muscle weakness (autoimmune)
risks_warnings.description: There are rare cases of autoimmune-mediated (meaning the body attacks itself) muscle weakness with Lovastatin. Let your doctor know if you notice severe muscle weakness. You may have to stop taking Lovastatin.

description_processed.orig: There are rare cases of autoimmune-mediated (meaning the body attacks itself) muscle weakness with Lovastatin. Let your doctor know if you notice severe muscle weakness. You may have to stop taking Lovastatin.

basics.benefits_moa: Pravastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Pravastatin can improve cholesterol, but it's not as strong as other statin medicines. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Not the best choice for people who have very high cholesterol levels.

Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

userStories.tip: You need to monitor Creatinine Clearance because - even though you may not experience muscle pain - all statins can cause rhabdymylosis (a form of muscle wasting) in a percentage of users. The waste product is excreted through the kidneys.
Try to take at bedtime for the best results.

Pravastatin lowered my cholesterol numbers significantly, but I'm not entirely convinced of the necessity of long-term, maintenance-dose statins for a person with my blood numbers. Also, at first I would feel tired and slow-witted.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

basics.benefits_moa: Simvastatin is cholesterol-lowering medicine called a statin. It lowers the amount of cholesterol your body makes, which helps lower "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and raise "good" cholesterol (HDL).
basics.bottom_line: Simvastatin is a good medication to improve your cholesterol. Statin side effects can be difficult to deal with, but the benefits might outweigh the risks.
downsides: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: Statins can cause digestive problems, blood sugar problems, muscle aches and stiffness, muscle injury, kidney damage, and liver damage. Some people have to stop taking this medicine because of these problems.

You're at higher risk for these side effects if you are female, are 65 years or older, drink alcohol every day, take more than one medicine for cholesterol, or have liver disease, kidney disease, or diabetes.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.

upsides: Lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides (fats) and raises "good" cholesterol (HDL) in people who have trouble doing this through diet and exercise.
Can lower the risk of heart attack, stroke, and death, particularly if you have diabetes, high blood pressure, obesity, or a history of smoking.

If you notice dark urine or yellowing of the eyes or skin, tell your doctor. Your doctor may also want to check your liver function periodically.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Don't use while pregnant it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.
risk_factors: Certain drugs can increase the dose of Simvastatin in the body

description_processed.orig: Combining certain medications can increase the risk of muscle pain (myopathy), muscle damage (rhabdomyolysis) and kidney damage. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist when taking any new medications.

risks_warnings.title: High blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Simvastatin can increase fasting (short-term) and HbA1c (long-term) blood sugar levels. Your doctor may need to check your blood sugar levels periodically.

description_processed.orig: Simvastatin can increase fasting (short-term) and HbA1c (long-term) blood sugar levels. Your doctor may need to check your blood sugar levels periodically.

carousel_items: Thins your blood to prevent clots from forming or getting bigger. Doesn't break up existing clots.
Can raise your risk of bleeding or bruising.
Take it exactly as instructed.
Interacts with a lot of medicines and supplements. Don't start any new meds without talking to your doctor.
Let your doctor know about any fever, weakness, or unusual bleeding or bruising.

basics.benefits_moa: Clopidogrel is an antiplatelet blood thinner. It prevents blood platelets from working, which makes it harder for your body to form blood clots.
basics.bottom_line: Clopidogrel works well to prevent blood clots and heart complications, but watch out for drug interactions.
downsides: Raises your risk of bleeding and bruising.
Lots of interactions with other drugs or supplements. Always check with your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new meds.
Doesn't work well for people with certain genetic variations.

downsides_processed.orig: Raises your risk of bleeding and bruising.
Lots of interactions with other drugs or supplements. Always check with your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new meds.
Doesn't work well for people with certain genetic variations.

upsides: Thins your blood to protect your heart after a heart attack or after a procedure on your heart.
Studies have shown clopidogrel lowers your risk of death or further heart complications.

upsides_processed.orig: Thins your blood to protect your heart after a heart attack or after a procedure on your heart.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack and stroke
risks_warnings.description: Clopidogrel may not work well for some people. Certain medicines that reduce stomach acid can also prevent Clopidogrel from working. Your doctor may order a genetic test to make sure Clopidogrel is right for you. Do not start anything new without first talking to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Clopidogrel may not work well for some people. Certain medicines that reduce stomach acid can also prevent Clopidogrel from working. Your doctor may order a genetic test to make sure Clopidogrel is right for you. Do not start anything new without first talking to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Life threatening bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Clopidogrel is a blood thinner that makes it harder for your blood to clot. Your body may not be able to stop bleeds the way it normally does. Taking the exact amount as instructed can lower your risk of bleeding.  Let your doctor know about any persistent or frequent bleeding or bruising, pink urine, red or coffee-ground like stools. If you are bleeding a lot for more than 15 minutes, have a bruise that is getting bigger instead of better, or have fallen and hit your head, go get immediate medical help.

description_processed.orig: Clopidogrel is a blood thinner that makes it harder for your blood to clot. Your body may not be able to stop bleeds the way it normally does. Taking the exact amount as instructed can lower your risk of bleeding.  Let your doctor know about any persistent or frequent bleeding or bruising, pink urine, red or coffee-ground like stools. If you are bleeding a lot for more than 15 minutes, have a bruise that is getting bigger instead of better, or have fallen and hit your head, go get immediate medical help.

risks_warnings.title: Unexplained bruising (Thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura or TTP)
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare, but life-threatening condition that might happen in the first 2 weeks of starting Clopidogrel. Get immediate medical attention if you develop purple patches, fever, and weakness.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare, but life-threatening condition that might happen in the first 2 weeks of starting Clopidogrel. Get immediate medical attention if you develop purple patches, fever, and weakness.
